title: Visualizing Electromagnetic Induction using Solenoid, Magnets and evive
description: This project demonstrates electromagnetic induction by using a solenoid, magnets, and an evive to visualize the induced current. The project aims to explain the principle behind electricity and related concepts and laws through a series of experiments.
steps: Wrap the PVC pipe with paper and glue it to create the core of the solenoid.
Wrap the copper wire around the PVC pipe to create a solenoid. Use different numbers of turns (e.g., 100, 400, 800) for comparison.
Connect one end of the coil to evive’s graph (prob V) pin and the other to the graph (ground) pin.
Configure the oscilloscope settings on the evive: Volt/Division: 0.1/s and Time/Division: 20mv/s.
Drop a bar magnet into the solenoid with the North Pole entering first and observe the peak generated in a positive direction on the oscilloscope.
Repeat the experiment with the magnet's direction reversed and observe the change in the graph on the oscilloscope.
Keep the magnet stationary inside the coil and observe the flat graph.
Experiment with different magnet speeds by dropping the magnet from varying heights above the coil and observe the changes in the induced EMF on the graph.
Compare the graphs obtained using different solenoids with varying numbers of turns (e.g., 100, 400, 800) and note the changes in the magnitude of the peak voltage.
